com.ibm.avatar.api

Class DocReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.avatar.api.DocReader

  • public class DocReader
extends Object
    This class provides APIs to read data from supported document collections. Once the instance of DocReader is created for a document collection use hasNext() and next() to iterate through the document collection and fetch each document as a Tuple. Supported document collection formats:
    • A UTF-8 encoded single text file with one of the following file extensions: .txt, .htm, .html, .xhtml, or .xml.
    • A directory that contains text files in UTF-8 encoding.
    • An archive file in one of the common archive formats (.zip, .tar, .tar.gz, .tgz) that contains text files in UTF-8 encoding.
    • A comma-delimited .del file in UTF-8 encoding in the following format:
      • Each row represents a single document. Rows are separated by new lines.
      • Each row has three comma-separated columns that represent the identifier (of type integer), label (of type string), and text (of type string).
      • The label and text string values must be surrounded by the character string delimiter, a double quotation mark ("). Any double quotation marks inside these values must be escaped ("").
      • The document label can be any character string, for example, a file name.
      • Here is an example .del file in this format that contains two documents with labels doc_1.txt and doc_2.txt.
        • 1,"doc_1.txt","This is an example document."
        • 2,"doc_2.txt","This is an example document with ""double quotation marks"" that need to be escaped.".
    • A CSV file with the first line being a header row defining field names separated by a delimiter (default: ','), and subsequent lines being a list of document records. Each line consists of exactly one record, with each field indexed by the name in the corresponding field in the header row. Here is an example .csv file in this format:
      • first_name,last_name,avg,hr,rbi,mvp // header row
      • Miguel,Cabrera,.366,44,139,true // first document tuple
      • Mike,Trout,.326,30,83,false // second document tuple
      • Nick,Punto,.219,1,10,false // third document tuple
    • A JSON file consisting of a list of document records, where each record represents a document and, optionally, external view content associated with that document. Each line consists of exactly one record, so a document and its associated external view content must be on the same line.
    • For more details, refer to Information Center, section: Reference > Text Analytics > Input collection formats .

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DocReader(File docFile)
      Create a new DocReader object for reading documents as tuples using a default schema (text, or text/label).

      Create a new DocReader object for reading documents as tuples using the specified custom schema.

      Create a new DocReader object for reading documents as tuples using the specified custom schema and custom field separator.

    • Field Detail

      • scan

        protected DocScanInternal scan

      • docFile

        protected File docFile
        References the file read by the current instance of DocReader

    • Constructor Detail

      • DocReader

        public DocReader(File docFile)
          throws TextAnalyticsException
        Create a new DocReader object for reading documents as tuples using a default schema (text, or text/label).
        Parameters:
        docFile - File containing the input document collection, in one of the supported formats.
        Throws:
        TextAnalyticsException - if a problem is encountered when loading or iterating through the document collection.

      • DocReader

        public DocReader(File docFile,
                 TupleSchema docSchema,
                 Map<Pair<String,String>,TupleSchema> extNameVsSchema)
          throws TextAnalyticsException
        Create a new DocReader object for reading documents as tuples using the specified custom schema.
        Parameters:
        docFile - File containing the input document collection, in one of the supported formats.
        docSchema - Expected schema of the input document collection; for non-JSON document, supported document schema are [text Text], [text Text, label Text] and [label Text, text Text]
        extNameVsSchema - map of external view name pair versus external view schema. External view name pair consist of: (1) view's AQL name as defined in create external view statement
        (2) view's external name as defined in external_name clause
        Throws:
        TextAnalyticsException - if a problem is encountered when loading or iterating through the document collection.

      • DocReader

        public DocReader(File docFile,
                 TupleSchema docSchema,
                 Map<Pair<String,String>,TupleSchema> extNameVsSchema,
                 char separator)
          throws TextAnalyticsException
        Create a new DocReader object for reading documents as tuples using the specified custom schema and custom field separator. Use for reading CSV files with a custom field separator.
        Parameters:
        docFile - File containing the input document collection, in one of the supported formats.
        docSchema - Expected schema of the input document collection; for non-JSON document, supported document schema are [text Text], [text Text, label Text] and [label Text, text Text]
        extNameVsSchema - map of external view name pair versus external view schema. External view name pair consist of: (1) view's AQL name as defined in create external view statement
        (2) view's external name as defined in external_name clause
        separator - the character to use as a field separator if reading from a CSV file. Optional.
        Throws:
        TextAnalyticsException - if a problem is encountered when loading or iterating through the document collection.

    • Method Detail

      • makeDocTextItr

        public static Iterator<String> makeDocTextItr(File docFile)
                                       throws TextAnalyticsException
        Creates an iterator to iterate over the text value of each document in the input document collection.
        Parameters:
        docFile - a file or directory containing documents in one of the supported formats
        Returns:
        an iterator that will return the text of the documents in the collection.
        Throws:
        TextAnalyticsException - if a problem is encountered when loading or iterating through the document collection.

      • makePairsItr

        public static Iterator<Pair<String,String>> makePairsItr(File docFile)
                                                  throws TextAnalyticsException
        Creates an iterator that returns a Pair object containing document name and document text for each document in the document collection
        Parameters:
        docFile - a file or directory containing documents in one of the supported formats
        Returns:
        an iterator that will return (label, text) pairs for the documents in the collection.
        Throws:
        TextAnalyticsException - if a problem is encountered when loading or iterating through the document collection.

      • makeDocandExternalPairsItr

        public static Iterator<Pair<Tuple,Map<String,TupleList>>> makeDocandExternalPairsItr(String docFileURI,
                                                                                     TupleSchema docSchema,
                                                                                     Map<Pair<String,String>,TupleSchema> extNameVsSchema)
                                                                              throws TextAnalyticsException
        Creates an iterator that returns a Pair object containing document text and external views content for each document in the document collection
        Parameters:
        docFileURI - a file containing documents in one of the supported formats (currently just JSON)
        docSchema - the expected schema for document tuples
        extNameVsSchema - map of external view name pair vs external view schema. External view name pair consist of: (1) view's aql name as defined in create external view statement
        (2) view's external name as defined in external_name clause
        Returns:
        an iterator that will return (docTuple, externalViewContent) pairs for the documents in the collection.
        Throws:
        TextAnalyticsException - if a problem is encountered when loading or iterating through the document collection.

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Returns true if there is at least one more document to be read from the collection.
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one more document to be read from the collection.

      • next

        public Tuple next()
        Returns a tuple containing the next document from the document collection.
        Returns:
        a Tuple with two fields label and text, containing the values of the label and text of the next document in the input collection.

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Reset the DocReader object.

      • getTextAcc

        @Deprecated
public FieldGetter<Text> getTextAcc()
        Deprecated. As of v2.1.1, use getDocSchema() to get the document schema and then use AbstractTupleSchema.spanAcc(String) with parameter "text" to get the text field accessor.
        Returns an accessor for the text field of the document schema. If no field with that name exists, returns null.
        Returns:
        Accessor FieldGetter for the text field of the document schema, or null if that field does not exist

      • getLabelAcc

        @Deprecated
public FieldGetter<Text> getLabelAcc()
        Deprecated. As of v2.1.1, use getDocSchema() to get the document schema and then use AbstractTupleSchema.spanAcc(String) with parameter "label" to get the label field accessor.
        Returns accessor for the label field of the document schema. If no field with that name exists, returns null.
        Returns:
        accessor FieldGetter for label field of the document schema, or null if that field does not exist

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        An array containing all the field in the specified external view schema

      • getExtViewTups

        public Map<String,TupleList> getExtViewTups()
        Returns a map containing the external view tuples from the document collection. Currently only documents in JSON format support reading of external views.
        Returns:
        a Map from String to TupleList containing the values of the external view tuples in this document collection

      • size

        public int size()
         throws TextAnalyticsException
        Returns the number of documents in the input collection. This method iterates over the input collection to determine its cardinality.
        Returns:
        the number of documents in the input collection
        Throws:
        TextAnalyticsException - if a problem is encountered when loading the input collection or when iterating through the document collection

        Parameters:
